body:
@srikanteswartalluri 
1. no direct commits to master please..
2. as per the review process, wait for two lgtms before doing a merge (and use the git pr script)
3. this is relevant for 4.6 branch ( and 4.5) so, PR should be for 4.6 and merged forward .

Please revert the direct commit and reopen the PR for 4.6

@karuturi 
Reverted the commit on master and 4.6

```
Check the password file in the Router VM ... === TestName: test_isolate_network_password_server | Status : SUCCESS ===
ok

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 367.955s

OK
```

So it was a fluke
LGTM
I just realised the target branch should be 4.6 meaning the PR should be for 4.6 and fwd-merged to master. Can you take care of that please @ProjectMoon

Well, the target branch for this is master so it will be put in 4.7-SNAPSHOT, but it's also intended to be cherry-picked back into 4.6 (which I obviously do not have the access to do).

I can create a second pull request on the 4.6 branch as well if you want. What is the proper procedure for this?

No cherry-picking. The PR should be only for 4.6 which will be fwd-merged to master(and hence will be available in 4.7 and up) 
I wish it was as easy as editing this PR and changing the target branch. But, github doesnt provide that and a new PR is required. Since the commit ids are same, when the 4.6 PR is merged both will be marked merged. (or you could close this now itself and just reference this PR in the new PR)
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/Release+principles+for+Apache+CloudStack+4.6+and+up
Since the branches are different, I will create a new branch off of 4.6, cherry-pick my commit to it, and then submit that as a new PR, which can then be forward merged.
Closed in favor of #1127.

Thanks @ProjectMoon 
:+1:  from me based on my previous tests.
ping @remibergsma and @DaanHoogland to merge
@DaanHoogland, @remibergsma, can this be merged in?

verified on 4.6.. working fine..
![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 5 59 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/186833/11423099/8a583474-9467-11e5-9fad-5b305fa5715a.png)

:+1:
I think #1119 can be closed as this PR will be fwd-merged

Pretty simple fix.
LGTM
Thanks @karuturi will close once this is merged, and 4.6 is fwd-merged.

Quickly tested for the docker images, behave correctly. 

LGTM

Thanks!
LGTM
LGTM, on code review
@wilderrodrigues @jayapalu @koushik-das Are you guys satisfied with this patch?
What's the status of this pull request? Do we need to redo this PR on 4.6 instead? Also what are the thoughts about squashing some of these commits down?
Guys, I am closing this and opening this request against 4.6.1 as I have been told that it is the new way now.
@jayapalu OK, no problem. FYI, we freeze on Dec 7.
@alexandrelimassantana Can you rebase please and resolve the conflict? Thanks!

reviewed the code. except for the use of English in comments it looks fine.

LGTM

Thanks @syed ! 
@pdion891 can you test this over the weekend? Then we can include it in 4.6.1.
@remibergsma We are building to test it now!
@pdube Great!

awesome job! can not wait to get it tested.

If all is fine, it would be great if it gets into 4.5.3 (/cc @bhaisaab) and 4.6.1 (/cc @remibergsma). I know a few users waiting for this fix!

This PR includes the unit test and integration test, very nice!
I will test it.

@jburwell Can you please conclude your review? If we can merge this in the coming days, it will be included in 4.7 which would be great I'd say!
@pdube Nice one, will give it a try!
@remibergsma I have rebased and squashed the commits for @rodrigo93

@pdube Had a look and you may also want to tweak these settings:

Network garbage collection:
network.gc.wait
network.gc.interval

Storage/Account cleanups:
storage.cleanup.interval
account.cleanup.interval

Furthermore I'd set default.page.size as the new infra tab in the UI doesn't like 10000 (which is quite large anyway).

Going to test these and will let you know. Thanks!

Be careful when merging to 4.6: we should first do a fwd-merge from 4.6 to master and then merge this PR to master, then do another fwd-merge. This one will get some conflicts, which we may want to address in a PR. Do you have time to help with this @karuturi ?

@bhaisaab had a busy week, so took a little longer ;-)
Thanks @remibergsma  :)
@rafaelweingartner @rodrigo93 I see more changes then needed in the diff. Are there proper line endings in the files? this is a usual problem in those cases.
@pdube Awesome you added all the tests! Thanks! Will have a run some tests myself soon.

My bad, I did not waited till the Maven fixed all of projects configuration.
I will fix that.
LGTM, code looks good. Haven't verified Debian packages though.
PR rebased and commits squashed for @rodrigo93

I am not sure if this allocator is used any where. As it is injected by it's interface StoragePoolAllocator, it will be a choice to use from a list. It is likely not to be used as it is clearly not properly configured. Someone might have fixed it locally however. I am not keen on deletion an option for users.
@rodrigo93 Jenkins can not merge this to master. please have a look.

@ustcweizhou LGTM, tested it and works as expected.

Minor comment: the first item in the list is empty (it will then keep the same template), rest of the items are the available templates. Should we make that first entry more explicit ("keep same template" or so)?

![screen shot 2015-11-28 at 14 28 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1630096/11452139/637621be-95dd-11e5-8048-a623968edb24.png)

![screen shot 2015-11-28 at 14 36 32 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1630096/11452143/7af87cce-95dd-11e5-8391-d572d7f1797c.png)

Thanks!
@bhaisaab @DaanHoogland Can you guys also review please?
@remibergsma I had already seen the code but missed the PR; LGTM

@DaanHoogland This is already much better, when you have 30 port forwarding rules the UI is unusable without this fix. When we want to make more improvements, let's make a new PR. I'd rather test another PR instead of this one again and try resizing ;-) Agree?
sure, it was not meant as a -1

@DaanHoogland, I got your point.
So, what about if we just fix the reference for that class in async-job-component.xml. We could also remove the reference for com.cloud.agent.manager.allocator.impl.FirstFitStorageAllocator that does not seem to exist.
If we want this in 4.6, please don't merge this. When #1116 is merged in 4.6, it will be fwd merged to master as well.
@pdube Any news on your testing? :-)
@DaanHoogland problem fixed ;)
@bhaisaab please make sure I made the right merge decisions. @karuturi @remibergsma second LGTM?
looks good, waiting on jenkins and will ask @remibergsma to schedule integration tests.
PR #1136 will bring this to master.

@pdube, no, there is a page on cleaning up the API but as the semantic version scheme commands we should only do that cleaning up per version 5.0. see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/API+changes
My preference is keeping related calls in one service and not have a Query service, or use it as a backend for the API command

@DaanHoogland I was talking about the implementation of APIs. Example, let's say you create a new module, call it Example. So we can list, create and delete Example. What are the classes that we expect someone to create? ExampleService, ExampleDoa, ExampleVO, etc.? That is what I was refering to. That way, if we decide that the best way to write modules is to have a service that is self contained, then we can phase out the use of the QueryService
